list_ex_of_english: We should beware of so burdening our staffs overseas that they become even more under pressure than at present.
Let us beware of the fate of the sheep.
The reader must beware that formula (3.6) does not make sense in general.
We ought to beware of loose thinking on the subject of monopolies.
I have been here long enough to beware of these technical preparations.
The maxim caveat emptor—let the buyer beware—still has relevance.
We must also beware of the market's tendency to destroy diversity, the tendency for it to produce lots of different kinds of the same thing.
If we are to send children to special schools because they have particular talents, we must beware how far this goes.
